content.raw:
Hi, Joshua

After downloading Cython the pyteomics.cythonize upgrade from 0.2.2 from your github was a success! I then proceeded to test the code in PyCharm. As you can see both fasta and mgf are also underline in red.

Using mass.fast\_mass and cmass.fast\_mass is fine.

When I try to use parser.isoforms and cparser.isoforms, the generator objects that are produced looked different.

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/7BxBr/images/1373771527-image.png)
Then if I proceed to print out each item in the generator object,  I receive an error from the cparser.isoforms: 

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/7BxBr/images/3386669189-image.png)
The above error was encountered when running the code in PyChram and thru Git-Bash

Carolina
content.html:
Hi, Joshua

After downloading Cython the pyteomics.cythonize upgrade from 0.2.2 from your github was a success! I then proceeded to test the code in PyCharm. As you can see both fasta and mgf are also underline in red.

Using mass.fast_mass and cmass.fast_mass is fine.

When I try to use parser.isoforms and cparser.isoforms, the generator objects that are produced looked different.

‌

Then if I proceed to print out each item in the generator object, I receive an error from the cparser.isoforms:

The above error was encountered when running the code in PyChram and thru Git-Bash

Carolina
